narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Dr. Gregoire is a spectacular professor - he went above and beyond to make the course material both useful and accessible to students. This was a great course - among the most practical of any I've taken at F&ES. I learned dozens of skills that I will be able to use directly in analysis of data from my own research.However, regarding 7c: I really can't say whether Christian was a good TA or not considering I never met him. He was out of the country for the ENTIRE SEMESTER. I realize PhD students need to TA courses to gain teaching experience, but this was truly ridiculous. The only contact I had with him was by email, when I sent him my homework assignments to be graded. I received little to no feedback on my performance when he emailed us back our grades, sometimes a month after we had turned in the assignments.If I wanted to get my graduate degree through a distance learning program, I would have signed up somewhere online. I am at Yale (and paying a lot of money) to learn in a real classroom.
Everything was just about perfect. The Professor mastery of the subject is evident. The TA was also very helpful and knowledgeable of the subject matter. Great course.
TA sometimes hard to reachCourse contents sometimes overwhelmingly complex
Dr. Gregoire's use of real data sets to demonstrate analytical techniques made this class very worthwhile.
The homework assignments were challenging and time consuming since you were basically learning the stats software (R) on your own, but it has been very rewarding now that I feel proficient in R.
Professor Gregoire is a wonderful instructor and really knows the field. I enjoy taking his classes and learn a lot from him.
The Professor's mastery of the subject. That gives you confidence in what you are learning in class.
The instructor's enthusiasm for the subject matter is contagious, and he was as thorough as time allowed in explaining the material.
Learning about regression models and how to build one

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The TA situation (see my comments above) and the fact that it was held in a classroom that was far too small for the number of students. People were sitting on heaters and chairs in back for the entire semester.
The text.

Not that this could be a fault of the class, but R is a very frustrating program to work with. I felt that I could have used a TA who was in the country to run a weekly session or something of that sort to help with my problems with the program.
May be the course should be made 4 credits so that there's enough time to cover more meterials.
We need to have a TA that is available in person, the material is too difficult to discuss over email.
Course contents sometimes overwhelmingly complex

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Tim is great and very responsive.
Instuctor:Awesome. TA: Not so much.
I never met him.

The instructor is wonderful and always willing to help. The TA is also very nice, and as helpful as he can be but was not in the country and as a result was simply not capable of helping as much as I would have liked.
They were both very available and flexible. Ready to meet you anytime to you suggest.

It is COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE for a TA for a course like this one at a university like Yale to be located in another country and inaccessible to the students. Prof. Gregoire made himself available for help very freely, but as a student it is sometimes easier to ask for help from a teaching assistant--in office hours, review sessions, etc--and that's what a TA is for, not just to grade homework.Feedback from the TA on homework assignments was limited to a numerical score and one or two words like "good job". The TA did not respond to email requests for help. The idea of communicating by Skype for help is ludicrous--this is a topic that necessitates give and take between student and instructors, including the TA, and both student and TA must be looking at the same lines of code on the same screen for this to be effective.When I speak to prospective students interested in this subject, I have to advise them about this deficiency. For what FES costs to attend, we deserve a real TA.
TA someimtes absentInstructor always helpful and available

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: As an MESc student, I will have to analyze my own data. This course gave me the basic skills to begin doing that - I could not ask for much more. PLEASE keep courses like this in the F&ES course catalog... Those of us in the MESc program need quantitative classes like this much more than we need policy classes that require literature review papers.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: quantitative skills, R programming
To learn skills I need for my own research.
Regression stats will inevitably be a part of my future research and professional career in ecology.
I wanted to learn more about regression as I feel it will help me with analysis of my own data in the future.
Because I needed more statistics. More regression. Not only that but statistic taught by one of the leading experts in the field.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Professor Gregoire is wonderful, but this course goes a bit too slow for someone with an econ/stats background.
yes
Absolutely, yes.
Yes
Yes. I learned a lot of new stuff.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I got to learn from my peer and discuss issues in somewhat informal environment.
Learning how to use R is much easier in a group rather than by yourself.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: put in the time up front to learn concepts, R programming
I wish I had had my own data ready to use for the final project. If you can take this class after you've collected initial data, it would be even more useful.
Read as much as you can about R and don't get frustrated when it doesn't work!
They should take it and make sure they make use of the Professor. He knows a lot about statistics. And if one consider to specialize in this field, this is the class to take.
Use R as much as you can
